seasons.name: Advent
seasons.description: Four weeks of preparation for Christmas. Year A/B/C Sunday cycle.

seasons.name: Christmas
seasons.description: From Christmas through Baptism of the Lord.

seasons.name: Lent
seasons.description: 40 days of penance; Holy Week leads to Easter.

seasons.name: Easter
seasons.description: 50 days from Easter Sunday to Pentecost.

seasons.name: Ordinary Time
seasons.description: Weeks of the year; green vestments.

mass_prayers.title: Penitential Act (Confiteor)
mass_prayers.text: I confess to almighty God and to you, my brothers and sisters, that I have greatly sinned in my thoughts and in my words, in what I have done and in what I have failed to do, through my fault, through my fault, through my most grievous fault; therefore I ask blessed Mary ever-Virgin, all the Angels and Saints, and you, my brothers and sisters, to pray for me to the Lord our God. Amen.

mass_prayers.title: Gloria
mass_prayers.text: Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace to people of good will. We praise you, we bless you, we adore you, we glorify you, we give you thanks for your great glory, Lord God, heavenly King, O God, almighty Father. Lord Jesus Christ, Only Begotten Son, Lord God, Lamb of God, Son of the Father, you take away the sins of the world, have mercy on us; you take away the sins of the world, receive our prayer; you are seated at the right hand of the Father, have mercy on us. For you alone are the Holy One, you alone are the Lord, you alone are the Most High, Jesus Christ, with the Holy Spirit, in the glory of God the Father. Amen.

mass_prayers.title: Nicene Creed
mass_prayers.text: I believe in one God, the Father almighty, maker of heaven and earth, of all things visible and invisible. I believe in one Lord Jesus Christ, the Only Begotten Son of God, born of the Father before all ages. God from God, Light from Light, true God from true God, begotten, not made, consubstantial with the Father; through him all things were made. For us men and for our salvation he came down from heaven, and by the Holy Spirit was incarnate of the Virgin Mary, and became man. For our sake he was crucified under Pontius Pilate, he suffered death and was buried, and rose again on the third day in accordance with the Scriptures. He ascended into heaven and is seated at the right hand of the Father. He will come again in glory to judge the living and the dead and his kingdom will have no end. I believe in the Holy Spirit, the Lord, the giver of life, who proceeds from the Father and the Son, who with the Father and the Son is adored and glorified, who has spoken through the prophets. I believe in one, holy, catholic and apostolic Church. I confess one Baptism for the forgiveness of sins and I look forward to the resurrection of the dead and the life of the world to come. Amen.

mass_responses.title: Lord have mercy
mass_responses.text: Lord have mercy. Christ have mercy. Lord have mercy.

mass_responses.title: Holy Holy Holy
mass_responses.text: Holy, Holy, Holy Lord God of hosts. Heaven and earth are full of your glory. Hosanna in the highest. Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord. Hosanna in the highest.

mass_responses.title: Lamb of God
mass_responses.text: Lamb of God, you take away the sins of the world, have mercy on us. Lamb of God, you take away the sins of the world, have mercy on us. Lamb of God, you take away the sins of the world, grant us peace.

A-Advent-1-Sun.title: First Sunday of Advent (Year A)
A-Advent-1-Sun.first_reading: Isaiah 2:1-5 – The mountain of the Lord's house shall be established.
A-Advent-1-Sun.psalm: Psalm 122 – Let us go rejoicing to the house of the Lord.
A-Advent-1-Sun.gospel: Matthew 24:37-44 – Stay awake; you must be prepared.

B-Advent-1-Sun.title: First Sunday of Advent (Year B)
B-Advent-1-Sun.first_reading: Isaiah 63:16b-17, 19b; 64:2-7 – Oh that you would rend the heavens.
B-Advent-1-Sun.psalm: Psalm 80 – Lord, make us turn to you.

C-Advent-1-Sun.title: First Sunday of Advent (Year C)
C-Advent-1-Sun.first_reading: Jeremiah 33:14-16 – I will raise up a righteous shoot.
C-Advent-1-Sun.psalm: Psalm 25 – To you, O Lord, I lift my soul.
C-Advent-1-Sun.gospel: Luke 21:25-28, 34-36 – Your redemption is at hand.
